alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 29 at 11:25PM CDT until May 30 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Custer County in central Nebraska... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1125 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Eddyville, or 21 miles south of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ansley, Mason City, Berwyn, Buckeye, Burr Oak, Gavin Siding, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road and Cumro. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 74 and 97. Highway 2 between mile markers 287 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
